meanings.definition: Making or having a shrill, grating sound by rubbing body parts together
meanings.sent1: The stridulatory cricket chirped loudly in the night.
meanings.sent2: The stridulatory wings of the grasshopper produced a high-pitched noise.
meanings.sent3: The stridulatory beetle tried to start a band with its noisy legs.
meanings.sent4: The stridulatory sound of the cicada filled the forest like a tiny orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The stridulatory noise was so piercing, it could be heard from far away.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the production of sound by rubbing body parts together
meanings.sent1: The stridulatory motion of the cricket's legs created a unique sound.
meanings.sent2: The stridulatory behavior of the grasshopper was fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent3: The stridulatory dance of the insects entertained the curious onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The stridulatory nature of the beetle's movements was like a silent symphony.
meanings.sent5: The stridulatory effect of the cicada's wings was mesmerizing to listen to.
